alert.note: Alert for Southern Big Horn (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 6:15PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Big Horn County through 700 PM MDT... At 612 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles northwest of Dayton, or 28 miles northwest of Sheridan, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Torrential rainfall could reduce visibility to near zero on Interstate 90 near Wyola. Wind gusts to 40 mph and half inch hail are are also possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Big Horn County, including the following locations... Wyola. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Localized flooding is possible. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
